Class ArrayList

  • java.lang.Object
    • ArrayList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    List

    public class ArrayList
extends java.lang.Object
implements List
    An implementation of List based on arrays

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ArrayList() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ReturnObject add(int index, java.lang.Object item)
      Adds an element to the list, inserting it at the given position.
      ReturnObject add(java.lang.Object item)
      Adds an element at the end of the list.
      ReturnObject get(int index)
      Returns the element at the given position.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if the list is empty, false otherwise.
      ReturnObject remove(int index)
      Returns the elements at the given position and removes it from the list.
      int size()
      Returns the number of items currently in the list.

      • get

        public ReturnObject get(int index)
        Description copied from interface: List
        Returns the element at the given position. If the index is negative or greater or equal than the size of the list, then an appropriate error must be returned.
        Specified by:
        get in interface List
        Parameters:
        index - the position in the list of the item to be retrieved
        Returns:
        the element or an appropriate error message, encapsulated in a ReturnObject
        See Also:
        List.get(int)

      • remove

        public ReturnObject remove(int index)
        Description copied from interface: List
        Returns the elements at the given position and removes it from the list. The indeces of elements after the removed element must be updated accordignly. If the index is negative or greater or equal than the size of the list, then an appropriate error must be returned.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface List
        Parameters:
        index - the position in the list of the item to be retrieved
        Returns:
        the element or an appropriate error message, encapsulated in a ReturnObject
        See Also:
        List.remove(int)

      • add

        public ReturnObject add(int index,
                        java.lang.Object item)
        Description copied from interface: List
        Adds an element to the list, inserting it at the given position. The indeces of elements at and after that position must be updated accordignly. If the index is negative or greater or equal than the size of the list, then an appropriate error must be returned. If a null object is provided to insert in the list, the request must be ignored and an appropriate error must be returned.
        Specified by:
        add in interface List
        Parameters:
        index - the position at which the item should be inserted in the list
        item - the value to insert into the list
        Returns:
        an ReturnObject, empty if the operation is successful or containing an appropriate error message otherwise
        See Also:
        List.add(int index, Object item)

      • add

        public ReturnObject add(java.lang.Object item)
        Description copied from interface: List
        Adds an element at the end of the list. If a null object is provided to insert in the list, the request must be ignored and an appropriate error must be returned.
        Specified by:
        add in interface List
        Parameters:
        item - the value to insert into the list
        Returns:
        an ReturnObject, empty if the operation is successful or containing an appropriate error message otherwise
        See Also:
        List.add(Object item)
